intro: Markea huilensis, commonly known as the Huiléan markea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Colombia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a smooth texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
